metadata.name: Less Mess (Much Less) #16
metadata.description:
Ok, there was enough mess, now let's bring the order back. 

The best results are from 1000x1000 and above.

This work was created using p5.js and ❤

Twitter: @AsafSlook

metadata.name: Life has no scores #142
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop “Nothing comes from nothing”. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‘2’ to save png.

Copyright (©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: sinuosity #199
metadata.description:
sinuosity is defined as:

- (n.) the ability to curve or bend easily and flexibly.

sinuous is defined as a couple of things:

- (adj.) having many curves and turns.
- (adj.) lithe and supple.

each curve anchors to the center. 

maybe that center is a life. (maybe that center is you.)

maybe that curve is a relationship. (or a job.) (or repressed trauma that needs processing.)

maybe that curve has other curves within. (it probably does.)

sometimes there are many curves at once. (usually this the case.) 

occasionally, there may only be one. (life isn’t always so complicated.) 

whatever curves the moment contains it can help to step away and see how they come together. (this is not always easy.)

[cc0] [p5js] [xoxo] [twitter: @heyjeres]

metadata.name: antigen #82
metadata.description:
float like a ketamine kiss. whispered; uninvited and unaware.

[ live view commands ]
[ S : save current size (fast) ]
[ 1 : save 2000x2000 png (not too bad) ]
[ 2 : save 4000x4000 png (takes a few) ]
[ 3 : save 6000x6000 png (slow) ]
[ 4 : save 8000x8000 png (quite slow) ]

metadata.name: Vers #40
metadata.description:
Vers

A flexibility in regards to position.

V : Switch the top to the bottom or vice versa
A : Toggle reveal animation/title card
S : Save current resolution
1 -> 5 : Save low -> high resolution

metadata.name: cliques #241
metadata.description:
clique is defined as:

- /klēk,klik/ (n.) a small group of people, with shared interests or other features in common, who spend time together and do not readily allow others to join them.

cliques can offer safety. (something about numbers.)

cliques can offer a place to be. (for better or worse.)

sometimes cliques have sub-cliques. (the intersections can get a bit complicated.)

sometimes a member of a clique may still feel outside of it. (power dynamics can ruin things.)

occasionally clique dynamics are balanced and the connections between the members pull towards the center. (we can consider that non-toxic.)

often, though, the connections are pulled in various directions and the connection between two members are swayed (or pulled towards) other members. (we can consider that toxic.)

[4 color palettes: monochrome, neon, vibrant rebellion, glacier]

[tap “s” to save image]
[tip: zoom out to 25% first to save a higher res image]

[cc0] [p5js] [xoxo] [twitter: @heyjeres]

metadata.name: Artifice #252
metadata.description:
This series is is about playful obfuscation.

The fxtext article linked on the main profect goes more in-depth into what is meant by that, as well as the events that led to this collection.

5640 bytes of Vanilla JS with no libraries. Palettes make up a third of the code.

In live mode:
‘S’ : save as png (3000 × 3600)
’V’ : save as svg (without grain)

URL params in live mode:
‘g=n’ : no grain
‘g=p’ : paper grain
‘h=t’ : high resolution mode, 9000 ×10600 (Chrome only, and may take a moment)

For example, if you wanted paper grain in high resolution, append “&g=p&h=t” to the url in live mode.

After rendering with these params, tapping 'P' will then save a png with those settings applied.

metadata.name: Tilemap #10
metadata.description: Tilemap project

metadata.name: The Beaten Path #68
metadata.description:
There's always an internal struggle between walking on the beaten path or off of it. And that comes from the illusion that the choice is really a thing. Although we are slaves of our internal processes, we shall never be the slaves of others. 

Keyboard shortcuts

- 1 : render @ original resolution
- 2 : render @ 2 x resolution
- 4 : render @ 4 x resolution
- x : download canvas as PNG @ current resolution

The project uses thi.ng/umbrella and fast-simplex-noise packages.

metadata.name: Sweeping #140
metadata.description:
Sweeping is a piece in which I explore the uses of noise fields. Using them in the most cliche way possible, but trying to make something unique out of that.

What started out as an innocent weekend project grew out to be quite the piece, which is why I am publishing it here.



Sweeping uses the GPU of your machine for its shading, which means it won't run particularly well on mobile devices. My recommended way of viewing this piece is on a PC with a dedicated GPU.

---

- Double Click to open a User Interface
- In the UI, you can toggle the paper texture and export

---

Made with p5js + webgl by Wouter Missler, 2022.

metadata.name: EDDY #275
metadata.description:
An eddy is a circular movement of water counter to a main current. It reminds me of innovations in art, like a small countercurrent to the mainstream, surfacing new techniques and aesthetics. 

I hope that EDDY will brighten your days with its playful swirl of colors, inspired by the sea, the sky, the birds, and post-impressionist paintings.

Keyboard Controls:
[F] Fill the window.
[S] Save the current view in live mode as an image (default 1125x1500px).
[1] [2] [4] [6] Change resolution, 1.5K to 9K.
[R] Reverse course.

Made with p5js and shaders.

Created by elsif, 2022.12.

metadata.name: The Spectrum Of Nature #135
metadata.description:
*\_../*`¬-’\/*`¬’’¬`*\/’-¬`*\.._/*

Nature, nature, evolving might… Silent inventor, always right.
Where is the edge of nature and where do we begin?  
What is of nature and what is of man? 
Isn't everything made by nature's hands?

To know more about the concept and technicalities of this piece, see the fxtext article “The spectrum of nature - a short making of”. Link at the bottom. If you’d rather just ignore my personal meaning, feel free to skip the article. 

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\

Basic info:
The piece comes in possible portrait or landscape versions. Both have a relative size of 1 by 1.5. So the initial render will be 1000px wide and 1500px high for portrait. And 1500x1000 for landscape. With the ability to scale this up (see below).

The piece uses WebGL, so will perform much better with a graphics card. A faster computer will obviously be better, though I've done my very best to make it fast and efficient for any old laptop. My hope is that you will find the render process quick and enjoyable for the amount of detail that’s present. 

../’`*’`\../’`*’`\../’`*’`\../’`*’`\../’`*’`\..

Controls:
Press the [s] key to save the initial render. You will need to wait a few seconds after all the elements have stopped loading. A box will pop up in the top left saying “done” for 4 seconds when it’s ready. For the [s] key to work you may need to open in a new tab. But can right click save otherwise.

Larger sizes:
Press the [2-9] keys to save a resolution of that key size. So [2] saves a 2000x3000 size image, [9] saves a 9000x13500 size image etc. Unless you are making some very large prints you probably won’t need more than 4k (even 2-3k is big). Though the option is there. 

There may be slight variations in the textures for the larger renders, this is because the shader code has to redraw the textures at the higher pixel resolution, and getting the textures where they sit is more of an art than a science. All the elements remain exact however. 

/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*/*

Made with javascript and some small extra code:
A palette creator by @nathansonic
Noisejs - github.com/josephg/noisejs - Perlin noise generator
Twgl - github.com/greggman/twgl.js - A small webGL helper.

metadata.name: Crypto Portrait #62
metadata.description: 13 crypto personalities highlighted for the #tezosartweek. The images are previously clipped, then processed by threshold and levels in order to be reinterpreted by the program. You can pull these well-known personalities from the crypto world ► Arthur Breitman: Ultra Rare ► Kathleen Breitman: Ultra Rare ► John McAfee: Super Rare ► Satoshi Nakamoto (x2): Rare ► Vitalik Buterin: Rare ► Sam Bankman: Common ► Justin Sun: Common ► Charles Hoskinson: Common ► Changpeng Zhao: Common ► Gavin Wood: Common ► Andre Cronje: Common ► Michael Saylor: Common ► Brian Armstrong: Common During the generation process ► Press h to hide this window ► Press j to display it' High quality ► Press 1,2,4,8 to increase the resolution ► Be patient.... ► Press s to save a png Features ► Personality ► Palette (10 vintage styles) ► Stroke amplitude ► Negative Space (On/Off) Made with p5js

metadata.name: Calm shapes #1467
metadata.description: simple shapes, simple palette, simple experience

metadata.name: Hydro Gen #68
metadata.description:
Against the backdrop of texts about valuing water, Hydro Gen charts the ecological devastation and eventual revival of the Tisza river following what has been called one of the gravest environmental disasters in central Europe since Chernobyl.

Nature and humans here are bound within a single frame — havoc in the ecological system activates the breakdown of meaning in the human signifying system of language, but hidden in the wave of ecological disaster is a (re)generative love poem to water that bears witness to its multifaceted beauty and power. A second poem is generated as a soundtrack based on the displayed background text.

- - - - - CLICK TO START SOUND - - - - -

Hydro Gen is a collaborative work conceptualized and developed over the course of one week as part of NFT DEB Generative Dimensions 2022 Hackathon and Conference.

Kalen Iwamoto, lead artist, director

Vitalii Shumanskyi, lead programmer

Nayven Vignette, audio programmer

Tamás Béke, data analysis and visualization

metadata.name: Life #4
metadata.description:
I see life in my paintings. Black and white in my watercolor brush. Houses, roads and trees. Maybe nature maybe. 

+My unique paintings and JSON.
